title: Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. reports on Second Quarter Results with Revenue of $1,124,742 And welcomes La Vie en Rose to Tri-City Mall
description: Toronto, Aug. 22, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. (TSX-V: GUF) an established company focused on the acquisition, management and development of anchored shopping centers in Western Canada, reports a 1.7% decrease in revenues to $1,124,742 in the quarter ended June 30, 2025, from $1,143,880 at the same period last year. Details of the six and three months financial results for fiscal 2025 and 2024 under International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), as summarized below
content:
The company is pleased to announce that, subsequent to the second quarter, it has signed a long-term lease with La Vie en Rose for Tri-City Mall, with anticipated opening in the fourth quarter of this year. In addition, the company has leased premises to IDK Deals and Le’s Heaven, run by two Cold Lake entrepreneurs.

Details of the six and three months financial results for fiscal 2025 and 2024 under International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), as summarized below, are also available at www.sedar.com or the company's website www.gpequities.com .

Toronto, Aug. 22, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. (TSX-V: GUF ) an established company focused on the acquisition, management and development of anchored shopping centers in Western Canada, reports a 1.7% decrease in revenues to $1,124,742 in the quarter ended June 30, 2025, from $1,143,880 at the same period last year.

Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. was incorporated under the laws of the Province of Alberta on April 8, 1998, and thereafter completed a public offering of common shares by prospectus dated June 26, 1998 (TSX-V: GUF).

The company acquires, manages and develops anchored shopping malls in Western Canada's rural center’s, particularly Alberta. Gulf & Pacific targets smaller, rapidly growing hub communities serviced with hospitals, high schools, police stations, and retail service infrastructures. Management has consistently reinvested cash flow to improve and expand its portfolio of income properties.

Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. owns three well-located retail assets in Three Hills, St. Paul, and Cold Lake Alberta.

summary: Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. (TSX-V: GUF) reports a 1.7% decrease in revenues to $1,124,742 in the quarter ended June 30, 2025, from $1.143,880 the previous year. The company also announced that it has signed a long-term lease with La Vie en Rose for Tri-City Mall and has leased premises to IDK Deals and Le’s Heaven, run by two Cold Lake entrepreneurs. Details of the six and three months financial results for fiscal 2025 and 2024 are available at www.sedar.com or the company's website.
shortSummary: Gulf & Pacific Equities reports a 1.7% decline in quarterly revenues to $1.124,742, and announces a long-term lease with La Vie en Rose for Tri-City Mall.
argos_summary: Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. has signed a long-term lease with La Vie en Rose for Tri-City Mall, expected to open in the fourth quarter of 2025, and has also leased space to two local entrepreneurs. The company reported a 1.7% decrease in revenues for the quarter ending June 30, 2025, compared to the same period last year. Gulf & Pacific focuses on acquiring and managing shopping centers in Western Canada's rural areas, particularly in Alberta.
